items.name: Activity Overview
items.value: count() by _path | sort -r
items.description: Shows a list of all Zeek streams in the dataset, with a count of associated records

items.name: Unique DNS Queries
items.value: _path=="dns" | count() by query | sort -r
items.description: Shows all unique DNS queries in the dataset with count

items.name: Top Domains
items.value: _path=="dns" | count() by domain:=join(split(query,".")[-2:],".") | sort -r
items.description: Displays the domains appearing most frequently in DNS queries

items.name: Top Domains (2nd-level + TLD)
items.value: _path=="dns" | put domain := re_replace(query, /^.*?([^.]+\.[^.]+)$/, "$1") | count() by domain | sort -r
items.description: Displays the domains (last two labels) appearing most frequently in DNS queries

items.name: Windows Networking Activity
items.value: grep(smb*,_path) OR _path=="dce_rpc"
items.description: Filters and displays smb_files, smb_mapping and DCE_RPC activity

items.name: Windows Networking Activity (SMB / DCE-RPC)
items.value: _path in ("smb_files", "smb_mapping") OR _path=="dce_rpc"
items.description: Filters and displays SMB and DCE-RPC activity

items.name: HTTP Requests
items.value: _path=="http" | cut id.orig_h, id.resp_h, id.resp_p, method, host, uri | uniq -c
items.description: Displays a list of the count of unique HTTP requests including source and destination

items.name: HTTP Requests (unique counts)
items.value: _path=="http" | count() by id.orig_h, id.resp_h, id.resp_p, method, host, uri | sort -r
items.description: Displays counts of unique HTTP requests including source and destination

items.name: Unique Network Connections (src:port -> dst)
items.value: _path=="conn" | count() by id.orig_h, id.orig_p, id.resp_h | sort -r
items.description: Displays unique source:port:destination connection pairings

items.name: Connection Data Volume
items.value: _path=="conn" | put total_bytes := orig_bytes + resp_bytes | filter total_bytes != null() | sort -r total_bytes | cut uid, id.orig_h, id.resp_h, orig_bytes, resp_bytes, total_bytes
items.description: Shows connections sorted by total bytes transferred

items.name: File Activity (Zeek files.log)
items.value: _path=="files" | filter filename != null() | cut _path, tx_hosts, rx_hosts, fuid, mime_type, filename, md5, sha1
items.description: Displays a curated view of file data including hashes for complete file transfers

items.name: Identify File Transfers from External Sources
items.value: _path=="files" | filter tx_hosts != rx_hosts | put total_bytes := if(orig_bytes != null(), orig_bytes, 0) | sort -r total_bytes | cut fuid, mime_type, filename, orig_bytes, tx_hosts, rx_hosts
items.description: Detects file transfers where the source and destination hosts differ

items.name: HTTP POST Requests
items.value: _path=="http" AND method=="POST" | cut ts, uid, id.orig_h, id.resp_h, method, uri, status_code
items.description: Displays HTTP POST requests including the URI and HTTP status code

items.name: Show Destination IP Subnets
items.value: _path=="conn" | put dst_net := network_of(id.resp_h) | count() by dst_net | sort -r
items.description: Enumerates destination networks (CIDR) and their connection counts

items.name: Top Talkers by Bytes Transferred
items.value: _path=="conn" | put total_bytes := orig_bytes + resp_bytes | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r total_bytes
items.description: Highlights hosts that transmit or receive the most data in the network

items.name: Top Talkers (initiators)
items.value: _path=="conn" | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Shows IP addresses initiating the most connections

items.name: Top Services by Destination Port
items.value: _path=="conn" | count() by id.resp_p | sort -r
items.description: Displays the most commonly used destination ports

items.name: Suspicious DNS Queries (non-alphanumeric)
items.value: _path=="dns" | filter query =~ /[^A-Za-z0-9\.\-]/ | count() by query | sort -r
items.description: Identifies DNS queries containing suspicious characters

items.name: Top HTTP User-Agents
items.value: _path=="http" | count() by user_agent | sort -r
items.description: Shows the most common User-Agent strings in HTTP requests

items.name: Failed Connection Attempts (S0)
items.value: _path=="conn" AND conn_state=="S0" | count() by id.orig_h, id.resp_h | sort -r
items.description: Displays failed connection attempts (no response)

items.name: HTTP Requests by Status Code
items.value: _path=="http" | count() by status_code | sort -r
items.description: Shows the distribution of HTTP response status codes

items.name: Large Data Transfers (>10MB)
items.value: _path=="conn" | put total_bytes := orig_bytes + resp_bytes | filter total_bytes > 10485760 | sort -r total_bytes | cut uid, id.orig_h, id.resp_h, orig_bytes, resp_bytes, total_bytes
items.description: Identifies network connections with data transfers greater than 10 MB

items.name: Top HTTP Methods
items.value: _path=="http" | count() by method | sort -r
items.description: Shows the most commonly used HTTP methods

items.name: Unique TLS Connections
items.value: _path=="tls" | count() by id.orig_h, id.resp_h, id.resp_p | sort -r
items.description: Displays unique TLS connections (Zeek tls.log)

items.name: DNS Queries by Response Code
items.value: _path=="dns" | count() by rcode | sort -r
items.description: Counts DNS queries grouped by response code

items.name: Top Destination IPs (receivers)
items.value: _path=="conn" | count() by id.resp_h | sort -r
items.description: Shows the IP addresses receiving the most connections

items.name: Long-Lived HTTP Connections
items.value: _path=="http" | put duration := ts - orig_ts | filter duration > 3600 | count() by id.orig_h, id.resp_h | sort -r
items.description: Detects persistent HTTP connections lasting more than 1 hour, possibly indicating data exfiltration

items.name: Longest Connections (by duration)
items.value: _path=="conn" | filter duration != null() | sort -r duration | cut uid, id.orig_h, id.resp_h, duration
items.description: Displays connections sorted by their duration (Zeek conn.duration)

items.name: Unusual Protocols
items.value: _path=="conn" | count() by proto | sort -r | filter proto not in ("tcp", "udp", "icmp")
items.description: Identifies traffic using less-common protocols

items.name: TLS Certificate Details
items.value: _path=="tls" | cut id.orig_h, id.resp_h, id.resp_p, subject, issuer, valid_from, valid_until | sort -r valid_until
items.description: Shows observed TLS certificate metadata (where available)

items.name: Outbound Unique Connections
items.value: _path=="conn" | count() by id.orig_h, id.resp_h | sort -r
items.description: Lists unique outbound connections from internal hosts

items.name: Database Connection Attempts (common DB ports)
items.value: _path=="conn" AND id.resp_p in (3306, 5432, 1433) | count() by id.orig_h, id.resp_p | sort -r
items.description: Identifies attempts to connect to common database ports (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MSSQL)

items.name: Unauthorized Port Scans (many S0s)
items.value: _path=="conn" AND conn_state=="S0" | count() by id.orig_h | sort -r
items.description: Detect hosts initiating likely port scans (many failed SYN attempts)

items.name: Internal Hosts Connecting to Rare External Ports
items.value: _path=="conn" | filter id.resp_p not in (80, 443, 53) | count() by id.orig_h, id.resp_p | sort -r
items.description: Identifies unusual external port usage by internal hosts

items.name: High-Frequency DNS Queries
items.value: _path=="dns" | count() by query | filter count > 100 | sort -r
items.description: Detects domains with unusually high request rates, possibly indicating automated activity

items.name: Suspicious TLD Activity
items.value: _path=="dns" | count() by query_root_domain | filter query_root_domain in (".gq", ".cf", ".ml") | sort -r
items.description: Highlights traffic to TLDs commonly used for malicious purposes

items.name: HTTP Requests to Sensitive Paths
items.value: _path=="http" | filter uri =~ /(admin|login|config|setup|backup)/ | count() by uri | sort -r
items.description: Identifies HTTP requests targeting sensitive paths

items.name: HTTP Requests with Suspicious URI Patterns
items.value: _path=="http" | filter uri =~ /(cmd|shell|phpmyadmin|admin|config)/i | count() by uri | sort -r
items.description: Identifies HTTP requests with suspicious URI patterns indicative of possible attacks

items.name: Unusual HTTP Methods
items.value: _path=="http" | filter method not in ("GET","POST","HEAD") | count() by method | sort -r
items.description: Highlights less common HTTP methods like PUT, DELETE, or OPTIONS

items.name: High Response Size with Non-GET Requests
items.value: _path=="http" AND method!="GET" AND resp_size>10485760 | count() by uri | sort -r
items.description: Detects large data transfers for non-GET HTTP requests

items.name: Expired TLS Certificates
items.value: _path=="ssl" | filter valid_until < now() | count() by id.resp_h | sort -r
items.description: Identifies hosts using expired TLS/SSL certificates

items.name: Weak Cipher Usage
items.value: _path=="ssl" | filter cipher in ("DES", "RC4", "NULL") | count() by id.resp_h | sort -r
items.description: Highlights hosts using weak or insecure SSL/TLS ciphers
